award_title: EAGER: Living Yarns from Phototactic Self-Assembly in Cyanobacteria Colonies
subject: Reference credit vs. actual reuse
body:
Hey Cecile,

Working on living materials means dealing with a lot of computational analysisâ€”imaging, modeling, tracking how organisms respond to light.

Problem is, when that code lives in a paper's methods section, it gets cited but rarely reused. Citations show acknowledgment, not actual influence.

Ouro makes computational methods discoverable and reusable as infrastructure. Your work gets used, not just referenced.

Happy to show you how it works if you're curious.

Hope you have a good holiday season.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
